item.title: Complex object randomizing command
item.dc:creator: @fasthop10 fasthop10
item.description:
@fasthop10 wrote:

heres what your making


if (playerCommand.startsWith("deck")) {
			for (int i = 0; i < 15; i++) {  // loop for x coords
				for (int e = 0; e < 15; e++) { // loop for y coords
					if (Misc.random(25) == 1){ // randomizes for a 1:25 chance
						int x = c.absX + i; // sets the x coords the that loop through
						int y = c.absY + e; // "" for y
						c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(3883 , x, y, 0, 10); // spawns and object for the random coords in the 15 by 15 space next to you
						
						// all of this below if for writing the lines to add into your object manager.
				String filePath = "./Data/trees.txt";
				BufferedWriter bw = null;

					try {
						bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
						bw.write("c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(3883 , "+x+", "+y+", 0, 10);");
						bw.newLine();
						bw.flush();
					} catch (IOException ioe) {
						ioe.printStackTrace();
					}
					}
				}
			}
		
		}

this code uses a double loop to check a 15 by 15 square of coords and in a 1 out of 25 chance place a tree there.

this can be used for a variety of things, but mainly made it for randomizing trees to make a forrest without having to do it by hand, ofc if theres ssomethign special u have in mind liek a path, you can set coords you dont want the trees to spawn to go back and remove them from the list of trees to add afterwords.

Read full topic
